intro: Chaetanthera asteroides, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
